(above, [line 77](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/53833/files#diff-128d1b6a626039bd139783f5354e8cb2R77)): `obj.Authorization.Mode = KubeletAuthorizationModeAlwaysAllow`

I would like to change this someday.

"DebuggingHandlers" is poorly named. I would eventually like this to go away, in favor of using authorization controls for this purpose. If we really want hard controls for this, I'd rather see a per-handler policy, rather than this vague categorization.

I'm not sure there's any action needed in this PR, just FYI.
What are the guidelines around modifying defaults like MaxPods? It seems like it shouldn't be a problem to increase it, but does that change once it's part of the API?

Yes. Values applied to omitted keys must remain stable; when you write a v1beta1 config, the meaning of that config must not change across Kubelet versions. Changing any default value requires an API version increase.
Is this an opportunity to set a global PIDs limit? xref: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/57973#issuecomment-357145850 @thockin
This is the max number for any given pod on the node.
